common.para_maximizar_traccion_ajustar_el_vaq_a: To maximize traction, set the VAQ to
common.la_vista_sport_solo_esta_disponible_en_u: Sport View is only available on hardware units 790 B+.
common.el_acceso_directo_al_chip_emmc_es_un_met: Direct access to the eMMC chip is an advanced method that can permanently damage the unit.
common.conectar_el_adaptador_dlink_dube100_al_p: Connect the D-Link DUB-E100 adapter to the MIB2 unit's USB port. Connect the Ethernet cable from the adapter to the Android device (via USB-C to Ethernet adapter) or to a WiFi router.
common.la_unidad_mib2_generalmente_tiene_una_di: The MIB2 unit generally has a pre-assigned static IP address in the 192.168.1.x subnet (frequently 192.168.1.4 for the host). Configure the device with a static IP in the same range (e.g., 192.168.1.10).
common.verificar_que_se_puede_hacer_ping_a_la_u: Verify that the MIB2 unit can be pinged before attempting to connect via Telnet.
common.el_servicio_telnet_puerto_23_puede_estar: The Telnet service (port 23) may be active but protected or inactive by default. On older firmware versions or specific Technisat ZR (Zentralrechner), this port might be open, allowing remote connection from a laptop configured with a static IP in the same range.
common.una_vez_establecida_la_sesion_telnet_se_: Once the Telnet session is established, access to the QNX command shell (ksh) is granted.
common.desde_aqui_las_restricciones_de_la_inter: From here, GUI (HMI) restrictions are irrelevant. You can manually mount the SD card (recognized by the system as a mass storage device at /media/mp000 or similar) and execute shell scripts (install.sh) directly.
common.descargar_el_mib2_std2_toolbox_desde_el_: Download the MIB2 STD2 Toolbox from the official GitHub repository and copy it to an SD card.
common.una_vez_instalado_el_toolbox_ejecutar_la: Once the Toolbox is installed, run the patching function from the Green Menu (GEM - Green Engineering Menu) accessible after installation.
common.verificar_que_el_toolbox_se_instalo_corr: Verify that the Toolbox installed correctly and is accessible from the system.
common.reiniciar_la_unidad_mib2_para_que_los_ca: Reboot the MIB2 unit for changes to take effect.
common.si_el_puerto_telnet_esta_cerrado_y_no_se: If the Telnet port is closed and cannot be activated via VCDS coding, the last resort is direct access to non-volatile storage.
common.muestra_los_puertos_en_escucha_telnet_ft: Show listening ports (Telnet, FTP, SSH, etc.)
common.muestra_informacion_detallada_del_hardwa: Show detailed hardware and process information
common.error_decrypt_failed: Decryption failed - incorrect key or corrupt data
common.error_pin_min_digits: PIN must have at least 4 digits
common.toolbox_not_installed: MIB2 Toolbox is not installed. Installation is recommended for full access.
common.toolbox_visit_forums: Visit specialized forums to get the latest version of Toolbox.

home.title: MIB2 USB Controller
home.control_remoto_para_unidades_mib2_std2_t: Remote control for MIB2 STD2 Technisat Preh units
home.‚ö†Ô∏è_el_puerto_telnet_esta_cerrado_se_: ‚ö†Ô∏è Telnet port is closed. Direct eMMC access is required.
home.adapter_required_message:
You must connect a USB-Ethernet adapter before connecting to the MIB2.

1. Connect the USB-Ethernet adapter to the MIB2 unit's USB port
2. Connect your Android device to the same network (WiFi or Ethernet adapter)
3. Go to the "USB" tab to verify the connection
home.no_connectivity_message:
The USB-Ethernet adapter does not have a valid IP assigned.

Verify that:
1. The adapter is connected correctly
2. The network is configured (DHCP or static IP)
3. The adapter has access to the MIB2 network
home.found_message:
MIB2 unit detected at {{host}}

Connect automatically?
home.full_scan_message: This will scan the entire subnet (may take several minutes). Continue?

home.telnet_closed_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Telnet port is closed. Direct eMMC access is required.
home.instruction_1: 1. Connect the USB-Ethernet adapter to the MIB2 unit's USB port
home.instruction_2: 2. Connect your Android device to the same network (WiFi or Ethernet adapter)
home.instruction_3: 3. Verify the MIB2 unit has Telnet enabled (root/root)
home.instruction_5: 5. Press "Connect to MIB2" to establish connection
home.warning_message: This application allows executing commands directly on the MIB2 unit. Use with caution and only if you know what you are doing. Incorrect commands can damage the system.

toolbox.title: Toolbox Installation
toolbox.not_installed: MIB2 Toolbox is not installed. Installation is recommended for full access.
toolbox.warning_message: This operation can permanently damage your MIB2 unit. Ensure you have a backup before continuing.
toolbox.confirm_action: Are you sure you want to continue?
toolbox.guia_paso_a_paso_para_instalar_el_mib2_s: Step-by-step guide to install MIB2 STD2 Toolbox
toolbox.subtitle: Step-by-step guide to install MIB2 STD2 Toolbox
toolbox.warning_text_1: Installing MIB2 Toolbox modifies QNX system files. An error can BRICK the MIB2 unit (value: thousands of dollars).
toolbox.warning_text_2: Patching tsd.mibstd2.system.swap alters the digital signature verification routine. Do not interrupt the process once started.
toolbox.warning_text_3: If something fails, the only way to recover the unit is via direct access to eMMC memory (soldering).
toolbox.script_generated_message: The installation script has been created successfully.
toolbox.critical_step_1_message:
This step modifies the system binary tsd.mibstd2.system.swap.

This alters the digital signature verification routine.

Continue?
toolbox.critical_step_2_message:
An error during this process can BRICK the MIB2 unit.

The only way to recover it would be via direct soldering to the eMMC memory.

Are you sure?
toolbox.critical_step_3_message:
Once the process starts, DO NOT interrupt it.

Ensure that:
‚Ä¢ The vehicle battery is charged
‚Ä¢ You will not turn off the ignition
‚Ä¢ The Telnet connection is stable

Execute patch NOW?
toolbox.backup_created_message:
Backup saved successfully:

Path: {path}
Size: {size} KB
Checksum: {checksum}...

Proceeding with patching...
toolbox.backup_error_message:
Could not create backup: {error}

Do you want to continue without a backup? (NOT RECOMMENDED)
toolbox.backups_auto_created: Backups are automatically created before modifying critical MIB2 system files.
toolbox.step1_desc: Connect the D-Link DUB-E100 adapter to the MIB2 unit's USB port. Connect the Ethernet cable from the adapter to the Android device (via USB-C to Ethernet adapter) or to a WiFi router.
toolbox.step1_warning1: Ensure you are using the D-Link DUB-E100 adapter specifically
toolbox.step1_warning2: The ASIX AX88772 chipset is natively recognized by the MIB2 firmware
toolbox.step2_desc: The MIB2 unit generally has a pre-assigned static IP address in the 192.168.1.x subnet (frequently 192.168.1.4 for the host). Configure the device with a static IP in the same range (e.g., 192.168.1.10).
toolbox.step3_desc: Verify that the MIB2 unit can be pinged before attempting to connect via Telnet.
toolbox.step4_desc: The Telnet service (port 23) may be active but protected or inactive by default. On older firmware versions or specific Technisat ZR (Zentralrechner), this port might be open.
toolbox.step4_warning1: If the Telnet port is closed, it cannot be activated via VCDS coding
toolbox.step4_warning2: In that case, the last resort is direct access to non-volatile storage (eMMC Direct Access) via soldering
toolbox.step5_desc: Once the Telnet session is established, access to the QNX command shell (ksh) is granted.
toolbox.step6_desc: From here, GUI (HMI) restrictions are irrelevant. You can manually mount the SD card and execute shell scripts directly.
toolbox.step7_desc: Download the MIB2 STD2 Toolbox from the official GitHub repository and copy it to an SD card.
toolbox.step7_warning1: Ensure you download the correct version for MIB2 STD2 (not MIB2 High)
toolbox.step7_warning2: Verify the integrity of the downloaded file
toolbox.step8_desc: This method 'injects' the MIB STD2 Toolbox installer by bypassing the SWDL update manager's digital signature validation.
toolbox.step8_warning1: This method bypasses the SWDL update manager's digital firmware validation
toolbox.step8_warning2: We are executing the script manually with root privileges
toolbox.step9_desc: Once the Toolbox is installed, run the patching function from the Green Menu (GEM - Green Engineering Menu) accessible after installation.
toolbox.step9_warning1: This patch modifies the system binary to alter the signature verification routine
toolbox.step9_warning2: Once patched, the system is instructed to consult the ExceptionList.txt
toolbox.step10_desc: Verify that the Toolbox installed correctly and is accessible from the system.
toolbox.step11_desc: Reboot the MIB2 unit for changes to take effect.
toolbox.step11_warning1: After reboot, the Toolbox should be accessible from the system menu
toolbox.step11_warning2: The Green Menu (GEM) will be available for advanced functions
toolbox.emmc_desc: If the Telnet port is closed and cannot be activated via VCDS coding, the last resort is direct access to non-volatile storage.
toolbox.emmc_step1: Physical extraction of the MIB2 unit from the vehicle
toolbox.emmc_step2: Disassembly of the chassis and soldering of a modified SD reader
toolbox.emmc_step3: Direct access to the pins of the eMMC (Embedded Multi-Media Controller) chip
toolbox.emmc_step4: Modification of the shadow file (passwords) or direct injection of patched files
toolbox.emmc_step5: Re-writing of the image to the chip
toolbox.emmc_warning1: This method is potentially destructive and requires advanced microsoldering skills
toolbox.emmc_warning2: Offers total control over the unit, even allowing 'bricked' units to be revived
toolbox.emmc_warning3: NOT recommended for users without electronics experience
toolbox.emmc_warning4: May void the warranty and permanently damage the unit
toolbox.emmc_technical_note: By dumping the eMMC image to a PC, the shadow file can be modified or patched files injected directly.
toolbox.diag_services_desc: Show listening ports (Telnet, FTP, SSH, etc.)
toolbox.diag_hardware_desc: Show detailed hardware and process information
toolbox.visit_forums: Visit specialized forums to get the latest version of Toolbox.
toolbox.telnet_not_active: Telnet is not active. Enable it from the Toolbox to use this app.
toolbox.ftp_not_active: FTP is not active. Consider enabling it for file transfer.
toolbox.old_version: Old Toolbox version detected. Consider updating.

fec.title: FEC Code Generator
fec.feature_enable_codes_para_activacion_de_: Feature Enable Codes for SWaP function activation
fec.activa_android_auto_para_dispositivos_an: Activates Android Auto for Android devices
fec.habilita_integracion_de_apple_carplay_en: Enables Apple CarPlay integration in the infotainment system
fec.habilita_integracion_de_android_auto_en_: Enables Android Auto integration in the infotainment system
fec.habilita_el_monitor_de_rendimiento_en_el: Enables the performance monitor in the digital cluster
fec.subtitle: Feature Enable Codes for SWaP function activation
fec.technical_note: The MIB STD2 Toolbox automates the 'patching' process. Instead of attempting to crack the VW private key (computationally infeasible), the Toolbox modifies the system binary to alter the signature verification routine.
fec.vehicle_data_desc: For custom code generation based on VIN/VCRN
fec.vcrn_invalid: Invalid VCRN (must be between 8 and 20 characters)
fec.confirm_injection_message:
Inject {count} FEC code(s) via Telnet?

The unit will reboot automatically.
fec.exception_list_generated_message: The ExceptionList.txt file has been created successfully.
fec.step1_desc: Use the FEC generator based on VIN and VCRN, or use predefined codes.
fec.step2_desc: Generate the ExceptionList.txt file with the desired FEC codes.
fec.step3_desc: Ensure that the MIB2 STD2 Toolbox is installed on the unit.
fec.step4_desc: Run the 'Patch tsd.mibstd2.system.swap' function from the Toolbox Green Menu (GEM).
fec.step5_desc: Once the system is patched, consult the generated ExceptionList.txt. Codes will be accepted as 'Legal' regardless of cryptographic signature.
fec.warning1: This method bypasses VW AG digital firmware validation
fec.warning2: Only works on 1-SD units that lack the necessary validation routines
fec.warning4: Perform backup before applying any modification
fec.android_auto_desc: Enables Android Auto integration in the infotainment system
fec.maps_row_desc: Activates ROW (Rest of World) map region
fec.carplay_desc: Enables Apple CarPlay integration in the infotainment system
fec.perf_monitor_desc: Enables the performance monitor in the digital cluster
fec.error_invalid_vin: Invalid VIN. Must be 17 alphanumeric characters.
fec.error_invalid_vcrn: Invalid VCRN. Must be between 8 and 20 characters.

recovery.title: üõ†Ô∏è Recovery
recovery.subtitle: Restore bricked USB adapters from backups
recovery.bricked_desc: Adapter has corrupt or incorrect VID/PID
recovery.connect_adapter: Connect a USB adapter with OTG cable
recovery.backup_location_message:
Backups are saved in:

Android/data/[app]/files/Download/mib2_backups/

To access:
1. Open "Files" or "My Files"
2. Navigate to: Android ‚Üí data ‚Üí [app_name]
3. Enter: files ‚Üí Download ‚Üí mib2_backups

Note: On Android 11+ you need to enable "Show hidden files" to see the Android/data folder.
recovery.create_backup_first: Create a backup before modifying adapters.
recovery.restore_success_message:
EEPROM restored correctly from backup.

üìä Bytes written: {size}
üîí Checksum: {checksum}...

Disconnect and reconnect the adapter for changes to take effect.
recovery.restore_error_message: Could not restore EEPROM from backup
recovery.force_restore_message:
This mode attempts to restore the EEPROM without security validations.

‚ö†Ô∏è WARNINGS:
‚Ä¢ Can permanently damage the adapter
‚Ä¢ Compatibility will not be verified
‚Ä¢ No prior backup will be created

Use this option ONLY if the adapter does not respond to normal methods.

Do you want to continue?
recovery.instructions_text:
1. Connect the bricked adapter with OTG cable
2. Verify it appears as "Bricked" above
3. Select a compatible backup (same chipset)
4. Tap "Restore" and confirm the operation
5. Disconnect and reconnect the adapter
6. Verify the VID/PID has been restored

If the normal method fails, use "Force" as a last resort.

auto_spoof.title: Automatic Spoofing
auto_spoof.requirements_message:
‚úÖ BEFORE CONTINUING, VERIFY:

1. OTG cable connected correctly
2. USB adapter plugged in firmly
3. Phone battery >20%
4. You will NOT disconnect the adapter during the process

‚ö†Ô∏è Disconnecting during writing can PERMANENTLY DISABLE the adapter.

Are all requirements met?
auto_spoof.critical_warning_message:
This operation will permanently modify the adapter's EEPROM.

‚ö†Ô∏è RISKS:
‚Ä¢ Can render the device unusable ("bricking")
‚Ä¢ Cannot be easily undone
‚Ä¢ Requires physical reconnection of the adapter

‚úÖ REQUIREMENTS:
‚Ä¢ ASIX AX88772A or AX88772B adapter
‚Ä¢ External EEPROM (NOT eFuse)
‚Ä¢ Stable power supply during process

Do you want to continue?
auto_spoof.final_confirmation_message:
This is your last chance to cancel.

The spoofing process will:
1. Read current EEPROM
2. Create an automatic backup
3. Write new VID/PID
4. Verify changes

Are you absolutely sure?
auto_spoof.warning_1: Only works with ASIX AX88772A/B adapters
auto_spoof.warning_4: Do not disconnect during the process
auto_spoof.detecting_eeprom_message: The adapter's EEPROM will be analyzed to determine if it is modifiable. This process is safe and modifies nothing.
auto_spoof.device_not_detected_message: No USB adapter detected. Connect a compatible ASIX adapter and try again.
auto_spoof.eeprom_detected_message: Modifiable {{type}} EEPROM detected. Do you want to continue with spoofing?
auto_spoof.error_not_compatible: The adapter is not compatible with MIB2
auto_spoof.force_no_verification_desc: Executes spoofing without verifying the result. Use only if normal method fails.
auto_spoof.name: Name
auto_spoof.quick_spoof_desc: Executes spoofing without additional confirmations. Only for experienced users.
auto_spoof.quick_spoof_message: Spoofing will execute directly without EEPROM verification. Continue?
auto_spoof.reconnect_instructions: Disconnect and reconnect the adapter to apply changes.
auto_spoof.spoofing_blocked_message: A {{type}} was detected. Reason: {{reason}}. Spoofing is not possible on this adapter.
auto_spoof.subtitle: Modify adapter USB VID/PID
auto_spoof.success_message: Spoofing completed successfully. The adapter now has the MIB2 VID/PID.
auto_spoof.test_fail_message: Spoofing test failed. The adapter may not be compatible.
auto_spoof.test_spoofing_desc: Checks if the adapter can be modified without making permanent changes.
auto_spoof.test_success_message: Test successful. Adapter is compatible with spoofing.
auto_spoof.verification_skipped_note: Note: Verification was skipped. Disconnect and reconnect adapter to confirm.
auto_spoof.already_compatible_message: The {{chipset}} chipset is confirmed compatible with MIB2 natively. No spoofing needed.

diag.title: Diagnostic
diag.logs_en_tiempo_real_de_todas_las_operaci: Real-time logs of all USB operations
diag.clear_logs_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete all logs?
diag.subtitle: System logs and diagnostics

settings.title: Settings
settings.help_description: Frequently asked questions about the app
settings.faq_adapter_a: Only adapters with ASIX AX88772A or AX88772B chipset with external EEPROM are compatible for spoofing. Realtek, Broadcom or adapters with eFuse are NOT compatible. The most recommended adapter is the D-Link DUB-E100 Rev B1.
settings.faq_spoofing_a: Spoofing modifies the USB Manufacturer ID (VID) and Product ID (PID) of the USB adapter so the MIB2 unit recognizes it as an authorized device. This allows the Ethernet connection required to install Toolbox and other modifications.
settings.faq_connection_q: How do I connect to the MIB2 unit?
settings.faq_connection_a: 1) Connect the spoofed USB-Ethernet adapter to the MIB2 USB port. 2) Connect your Android device to the same network (WiFi or Ethernet adapter). 3) The MIB2 normally uses IP 192.168.1.4. 4) Use the app to connect via Telnet with credentials root/root.
settings.faq_toolbox_a: MIB2 Toolbox is a set of tools installed on the unit to enable hidden features like CarPlay, Android Auto, Sport View, digital cockpit customization, and more. Requires Telnet access and a compatible USB-Ethernet adapter.
settings.faq_fec_a: FEC (Feature Enable Code) codes are activation codes that unlock premium functions in the MIB2 unit. Each code activates a specific function like CarPlay (00060800), Android Auto (00060900) or Performance Monitor (00060400).
settings.faq_risk_a: EEPROM spoofing is permanent and can damage the adapter if interrupted. Modifications to the MIB2 can cause malfunction or void warranty. Always create backups before any modification. This app is for advanced users who understand the risks.
settings.tienes_acceso_a_comandos_que_pueden_dana: You have access to commands that can damage the MIB2 unit. Proceed with extreme caution.
settings.subtitle: Adjust application parameters
settings.setup_pin_required: You must first set up a security PIN to use Expert Mode
settings.reset_pin_confirm: Are you sure? This will deactivate Expert Mode and delete the configured PIN.
settings.expert_mode_warning: You have access to commands that can damage the MIB2 unit. Proceed with extreme caution.
settings.ip_address_desc: IP address of the MIB2 unit on the local network
settings.security_warning_text: This application allows executing commands with root privileges on the MIB2 unit. Incorrect use can result in permanent system damage. Use this tool at your own risk.

warnings.bricking_message: This operation can permanently damage your USB adapter. Ensure you have a backup before continuing.

alerts.el_dispositivo_usb_se_desconect√≥_por_fa: The USB device disconnected. Please reconnect and try again.

usb.reprogramacion_automatica_de_eeprom_para: Automatic EEPROM reprogramming for compatible ASIX adapters
usb.create_backup_message: A backup of the current EEPROM will be created
usb.disconnect_confirm: Do you want to disconnect the device?
usb.name: Name
usb.not_compatible_recommend: Not compatible - Another adapter is recommended
usb.tip_3: If not detected, disconnect and reconnect
usb.can_be_modified: This adapter CAN be safely modified via spoofing.
usb.cannot_be_modified: This adapter CANNOT be modified. Spoofing is BLOCKED to prevent bricking.

onboarding.step1_desc: Connect your USB-Ethernet adapter to the Android device using an OTG cable with external power.
onboarding.step1_detail1: Use an OTG cable with external power (5V)
onboarding.step1_detail2: Connect the USB-Ethernet adapter to the OTG cable
onboarding.step1_detail3: Wait for the adapter LED to turn on
onboarding.step1_detail4: The app will automatically detect the device
onboarding.step2_desc: The app will automatically detect the chipset and show if it is compatible for MIB2 spoofing.
onboarding.step2_detail1: Go to 'USB Status' tab to view device info
onboarding.step3_desc: Use Auto Spoof to automatically modify the adapter's VID/PID to values compatible with MIB2.
onboarding.step3_detail3: The app will create an automatic backup before modifying
onboarding.step3_detail4: Wait for process to finish (30-60 seconds)
onboarding.step3_detail5: DO NOT disconnect the adapter during the process
onboarding.step4_desc: After spoofing, verify that the VID/PID was modified correctly and test the connection with MIB2.
onboarding.step4_detail3: Connect the adapter to the MIB2 USB port
onboarding.step4_detail5: If it fails, restore from backup in 'Backups' tab

chipset.confirmed_message: {{chipset}} is confirmed compatible for MIB2 spoofing. Tested and working correctly.
chipset.experimental_message: {{chipset}} is experimental. Shares similar ASIX architecture and should work, but is not 100% confirmed.
chipset.incompatible_message: {{chipset}} is NOT compatible with spoofing on Android. Requires specific tools or does not support VID/PID modification.
chipset.unknown_message: {{chipset}} is unknown. No compatibility information for MIB2 spoofing available.

macros.full_backup_desc: Creates a full backup of adaptations and configuration
macros.backup_adaptations_desc: Creates a backup of adaptations only
macros.enable_all_features_desc: Activates Green Menu, Video in Motion, and camera guidelines
macros.safe_adaptations_desc: Activates only safe adaptations (Green Menu and guidelines)
macros.system_health_check_desc: Checks memory, disk, temperature, and processes
macros.firmware_info_desc: Gets detailed firmware and hardware information
macros.cleanup_system_desc: Cleans temporary files and old logs

safety.cap_carbon_cupra_skins: Compatible with Carbon and Cupra skins (Variants 2 and 3)
safety.issue_1sd_no_signature: Some 1-SD units lack signature validation routines
safety.unknown_hardware_message: Part number "{{partNumber}}" is not in the known hardware database.
safety.unknown_hardware_details: Modifications may work, but there is no guarantee of full compatibility.
safety.unknown_firmware_message: Firmware version "{{version}}" is not in the database.
safety.unidentified_hardware_message: Cannot validate FEC code compatibility without identifying hardware.
safety.unidentified_firmware_message: Cannot guarantee the injection method will work with this firmware.
safety.fec_validation_message: FEC code injection bypasses VW AG digital firmware validation.
safety.fec_technical_details: The patching method modifies the system binary to alter the signature verification routine.
safety.rec_verify_part_number: Verify part number on the unit label
safety.rec_check_manual: Consult vehicle manual to confirm version
safety.rec_proceed_caution: Proceed with caution when applying modifications
safety.rec_verify_firmware: Verify firmware version in system menu
safety.rec_consider_update: Consider updating to a known version
safety.xds_strong_message: DO NOT configure XDS+ in "Strong" (Stark) mode. This setting causes parasitic brake wear and thermal stress without tangible benefits.
safety.xds_brake_fluid_warning: Brake fluid can reach boiling point (vapor lock)
safety.xds_pads_warning: A set of pads can be destroyed in a single track session
safety.xds_vaq_conflict: In vehicles with VAQ, it generates a conflicting control loop
safety.xds_technical: Recommended setting: "Standard". XDS+ should act only as a last resort safety net.
safety.vaq_traction_message: To maximize traction, set the VAQ to "Increased Traction" instead of modifying XDS+.
safety.vaq_aggressive_lock: Allows more aggressive and faster locking of clutch plates
safety.vaq_acoustic_tradeoff: Sacrifices acoustic smoothness for higher performance
safety.vaq_mechanical_superior: VAQ is mechanically superior and thermally efficient
safety.vaq_noise_warning: Creaking or tire dragging may be heard in tight turns at low speed
safety.vaq_technical: VAQ (Vorderachsquersperre) is the electro-hydraulic limited-slip differential.
safety.vista_sport_message: Sport View is only available on hardware units 790 B+.
safety.vista_verify_hardware: Verify hardware part number before attempting to activate
safety.vista_not_available: On 790, 790A, or 790B units without the "+" suffix, Sport View will not be available
safety.vista_consider_upgrade: Consider hardware upgrade if this feature is required
safety.vista_technical: Sport View is a hardware feature requiring the specific digital cluster of the B+ revision.
safety.emmc_access_message: Direct access to the eMMC chip is an advanced method that can permanently damage the unit.
safety.emmc_expert_only: Only for users with electronics experience
safety.emmc_last_resort: Last resort when other methods fail
safety.emmc_technical: This method involves soldering directly to the eMMC chip pins to access non-volatile memory.
safety.conclusion_critical: Critical problems or errors found. Review recommendations before proceeding.

profiles.dub_e100_b1_notes: Alternative version of DUB-E100, also compatible with MIB2.
profiles.tplink_ue300_notes: Common Gigabit adapter. Requires spoofing for MIB2.
profiles.tplink_ue200_notes: TP-Link Fast Ethernet adapter. Requires spoofing.
profiles.tplink_wl_notes: Common ASIX adapter. Ideal for spoofing to D-Link DUB-E100.
profiles.asix_generic_notes: Generic ASIX chipset. Compatible with spoofing.
profiles.asix_generic_a_notes: Generic ASIX chipset (version A). Compatible with spoofing.
profiles.realtek_rtl8153_notes: Common Realtek Gigabit chipset. Requires spoofing.
profiles.microchip_lan9512_notes: Common Microchip chipset on Raspberry Pi. NOT compatible with spoofing.
profiles.microchip_lan7800_notes: Microchip Gigabit USB 3.0 chipset. NOT compatible with spoofing.
profiles.davicom_dm9601_notes: Cheap Davicom chipset. NOT compatible with spoofing.
profiles.error_import_failed: Could not import profile: Invalid JSON
profiles.error_verification_failed: Verification failed: written values do not match
profiles.realtek_not_compatible: Realtek chipsets are NOT compatible with spoofing on Android. They require Linux/Windows kernel drivers and specific tools (PG Tool). Consider getting an ASIX adapter.
profiles.microchip_not_compatible: Microchip chipsets DO NOT support VID/PID modification. Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets are compatible.
profiles.broadcom_not_compatible: Broadcom chipsets DO NOT support VID/PID modification. Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets are compatible.
profiles.davicom_not_compatible: Davicom chipsets DO NOT support VID/PID modification. Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets are compatible.
profiles.only_asix_compatible: Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets support EEPROM spoofing for MIB2.
profiles.cannot_delete_only_profile: You cannot delete the only profile

backups.title: EEPROM Backups
backups.subtitle: Manage backup copies
backups.no_backups_message: Create a backup from the USB screen when you have an adapter connected.
backups.no_device_connected: No USB device connected. Connect an adapter to restore.
backups.restore_vidpid_warning:
This operation will modify the VID/PID of the connected USB adapter.

Make sure that:
‚Ä¢ The correct adapter is connected
‚Ä¢ Do not disconnect the adapter during the process

Continue?
backups.share_not_available: Share function is not available on this device.
backups.connect_to_restore: Connect a USB adapter to restore backups.
backups.security_notice_text: Full EEPROM restoration is DISABLED for security. Only VID/PID restoration is allowed using a tested and safe function.
backups.integrity_system_desc: Each backup is verified with MD5 and SHA256 checksums before allowing restoration. Invalid or corrupted backups cannot be restored.
backups.restore_blocked_integrity: Restoration is blocked because the backup failed integrity verification. Verify the backup or use a different one.
backups.restore_requires_valid_integrity: Only backups with valid integrity can be restored. Press 'Verify Integrity' to check.

telnet_scripts.scripts_warning: These scripts modify the MIB2 system. Use at your own risk.
telnet_scripts.default_warning: This command will modify the system. Continue?
telnet_scripts.category_verification_desc: Read-only commands to verify system status
telnet_scripts.category_activation_desc: Activate features and patch the system
telnet_scripts.category_backup_desc: Backup the system before critical modifications
telnet_scripts.check_sd_space_desc: Check available space on SD card for backups
telnet_scripts.backup_tsd_swap_desc: MANDATORY: Backup tsd.mibstd2.system.swap binary before patching. Without this backup, you won't be able to restore if something goes wrong.
telnet_scripts.backup_tsd_swap_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This is the most critical backup. Without it, you won't be able to recover MIB2 if patching fails.
telnet_scripts.backup_etc_warning: This backup includes all system configuration.
telnet_scripts.list_backups_desc: Shows all backups saved on SD
telnet_scripts.restore_tsd_swap_desc: Restore tsd.mibstd2.system.swap binary from last backup. USE ONLY IF SYSTEM FAILS.
telnet_scripts.restore_tsd_swap_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è DANGER: Only use this if MIB2 doesn't work properly after patching. Will restore system to previous state.
telnet_scripts.restore_tsd_swap_success: ‚úÖ Critical binary restored. Restart MIB2 to apply.
telnet_scripts.check_partition_sizes_desc: Shows the size of all system partitions. Needed to know how much space the backup requires.
telnet_scripts.dd_backup_system_desc: ‚ö†Ô∏è ADVANCED: Creates a complete system image with dd. REQUIRES A LOT OF SPACE (several GB) and TIME (10-30 min). Expert users only.
telnet_scripts.dd_backup_system_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: This process may take 10-30 minutes and requires several GB of free space on SD. DO NOT interrupt the process.
telnet_scripts.dd_backup_partition1_desc: Creates an image of partition 1 (main system). Faster than full backup.
telnet_scripts.dd_backup_partition_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è This process may take several minutes. DO NOT interrupt the process.
telnet_scripts.verify_backup_md5_desc: Calculates MD5 checksum of the last backup to verify its integrity.
telnet_scripts.dd_restore_system_desc: ‚ö†Ô∏è EXTREME DANGER: Restores the complete system from a dd image. ONLY USE IF SYSTEM IS COMPLETELY DAMAGED.
telnet_scripts.dd_restore_system_warning: ‚ò†Ô∏è EXTREME DANGER: This operation will COMPLETELY overwrite the system. Only use as last resort if MIB2 won't boot. Command is shown but NOT executed automatically for safety.
telnet_scripts.dd_progress_warning: DO NOT close the app or disconnect the device during backup
telnet_scripts.cancel_backup_confirm: Are you sure you want to cancel the backup in progress? The partial file will be incomplete and you will need to delete it manually.
telnet_scripts.backup_cancelled_msg: The backup process has been interrupted. Check if a partial file exists in /mnt/sd/ and delete it if necessary.
telnet_scripts.verify_root_desc: Verify that you have root access to the MIB2 system
telnet_scripts.check_sd_mounted_desc: Verify if the SD card is already mounted at /mnt/sd
telnet_scripts.check_eso_desc: Verify if Toolbox is already installed in /eso
telnet_scripts.system_info_desc: Shows QNX system information (version, memory, etc.)
telnet_scripts.create_mount_point_desc: Creates the /mnt/sd directory if it doesn't exist
telnet_scripts.mount_sd_qnx6_desc: Mounts the SD card with QNX6 filesystem
telnet_scripts.mount_sd_warning: This command mounts the SD card. Make sure the SD is inserted correctly.
telnet_scripts.mount_sd_alt1_desc: Try to mount SD with alternative path /dev/mmc0t01
telnet_scripts.mount_sd_alt2_desc: Try to mount SD with alternative path /dev/sd0
telnet_scripts.list_sd_contents_desc: Shows the contents of the mounted SD card
telnet_scripts.set_permissions_desc: Gives execution permissions to installation scripts
telnet_scripts.run_install_desc: Runs the Toolbox install.sh script. IMPORTANT: Follow on-screen instructions.
telnet_scripts.run_install_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: This command installs Toolbox on MIB2. DO NOT interrupt the process. Answer 'y' when prompted.
telnet_scripts.run_install_success: ‚úÖ Installation completed. Restart MIB2 to apply changes.
telnet_scripts.run_install_sh_desc: Alternative: Run install.sh using sh interpreter
telnet_scripts.run_bootstrap_desc: Alternative: Run bootstrap.sh script if install.sh fails
telnet_scripts.verify_installation_desc: Verify that Toolbox was installed correctly in /eso
telnet_scripts.run_gem_desc: Starts the GEM menu to patch and activate features
telnet_scripts.run_gem_warning: GEM allows modifying advanced settings. Use with caution.
telnet_scripts.patch_swap_desc: Applies the tsd.mibstd2.system.swap patch to enable features
telnet_scripts.patch_swap_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: This patch modifies the system. Make sure you have a backup.
telnet_scripts.reboot_mib_desc: Restarts the MIB2 system. Telnet connection will be lost.
telnet_scripts.reboot_warning: MIB2 will restart and Telnet connection will close. Wait 30 seconds before reconnecting.
